briefdescription.para: Do not rotate.
Rotate 90 degrees clockwise.
Rotate 180 degrees.
Rotate 270 degrees clockwise (90 degrees counterclockwise)

detaileddescription.para: The type of rotation to apply for an operation

briefdescription.para: The action when a page is "opened".
The action when a page is "closed".

detaileddescription.para: The kinds of page actions

briefdescription.para: The text is layouted to resemble the real page layout.
The text is returned without any type of processing.

detaileddescription.para:
How the text is going to be returned
0.16
Do not save/restore the caller-owned painter.
renderToPainter() by default preserves, using save() + restore(), the state of the painter specified; if this is not needed, this flag can avoid this job

Additional flags for the renderToPainter method
0.16

briefdescription.para: Start sorting at the top of the document.
Find the next result, moving "down the page".
Find the previous result, moving "up the page".

detaileddescription.para: The starting point for a search

briefdescription.para: Case differences cause no match in searching.
Case differences are ignored in matching.

detaileddescription.para: The type of search to perform

briefdescription.para: Case differences are ignored.
Only whole words are matched.

detaileddescription.para:
Flags to modify the search behaviour
0.31

briefdescription.para: Landscape orientation (portrait, with 90 degrees clockwise rotation )
Normal portrait orientation.
Seascape orientation (portrait, with 270 degrees clockwise rotation)
Upside down orientation (portrait, with 180 degrees rotation)

detaileddescription.para: Types of orientations that are possible
Destructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (double xres=72.0, double yres=72.0, int x=-1, int y=-1, int w=-1, int h=-1, Rotation rotate=Rotate0) const
memberdef.name: renderToImage

detaileddescription.para: Render the page to a QImage using the current Document renderer.

If x = y = w = h = -1, the method will automatically compute the size of the image from the horizontal and vertical resolutions specified in xres and yres. Otherwise, the method renders only a part of the page, specified by the parameters (x, y, w, h) in pixel coordinates. The returned QImage then has size (w, h), independent of the page size.

parameterdescription.para: specifies the left x-coordinate of the box, in pixels.
specifies the top y-coordinate of the box, in pixels.
specifies the width of the box, in pixels.
specifies the height of the box, in pixels.
horizontal resolution of the graphics device, in dots per inch
vertical resolution of the graphics device, in dots per inch
how to rotate the page

simplesect.para: The parameter (x, y, w, h) are not well-tested. Unusual or meaningless parameters may lead to rather unexpected results.
a QImage of the page, or a null image on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPainter *painter, double xres=72.0, double yres=72.0, int x=-1, int y=-1, int w=-1, int h=-1, Rotation rotate=Rotate0, PainterFlags flags=0) const
memberdef.name: renderToPainter

detaileddescription.para: Render the page to the specified QPainter using the current Document renderer.

If x = y = w = h = -1, the method will automatically compute the size of the page area from the horizontal and vertical resolutions specified in xres and yres. Otherwise, the method renders only a part of the page, specified by the parameters (x, y, w, h) in pixel coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: the painter to paint on
specifies the left x-coordinate of the box, in pixels.
specifies the top y-coordinate of the box, in pixels.
specifies the width of the box, in pixels.
specifies the height of the box, in pixels.
horizontal resolution of the graphics device, in dots per inch
vertical resolution of the graphics device, in dots per inch
how to rotate the page
additional painter flags

simplesect.para: The parameter (x, y, w, h) are not well-tested. Unusual or meaningless parameters may lead to rather unexpected results.
This method is only supported for Arthur

detaileddescription.para: Get the page thumbnail if it exists.

simplesect.para: a QImage of the thumbnail, or a null image if the PDF does not contain one for this page

detaileddescription.para: Returns the text that is inside a specified rectangle

parameterdescription.para: the rectangle specifying the area of interest, with coordinates given in points, i.e., 1/72th of an inch. If rect is null, all text on the page is given

detaileddescription.para: Returns the text that is inside a specified rectangle. The text is returned using the physical layout of the page

parameterdescription.para: the rectangle specifying the area of interest, with coordinates given in points, i.e., 1/72th of an inch. If rect is null, all text on the page is given

parameterdescription.para: the text to search
whether to be case sensitive
the rotation to apply for the search order

simplesect.para: Do not use the returned QRectF as arguments of another search call because of truncation issues if qreal is defined as float.

memberdef.name: search

detaileddescription.para: Returns a list of all occurrences of the specified text on the page.

parameterdescription.para: the text to search
the flags to consider during matching
the rotation to apply for the search order

simplesect.para: Do not use the returned QRectF as arguments of another search call because of truncation issues if qreal is defined as float.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a list of text of the page
This method returns a QList of TextBoxes that contain all the text of the page, with roughly one text word of text per TextBox item.
For text written in western languages (left-to-right and up-to-down), the QList contains the text in the proper order.

simplesect.para: The caller owns the text boxes and they should be deleted when no longer required.
This method is not tested with Asian scripts
The dimensions (cropbox) of the page, in points (i.e. 1/72th of an inch)
The dimensions (cropbox) of the page, in points (i.e. 1/72th of an inch)

detaileddescription.para: Returns the transition of this page

simplesect.para: a pointer to a PageTransition structure that defines how transition to this page shall be performed.
The PageTransition structure is owned by this page, and will automatically be destroyed when this page class is destroyed.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the page action specified, or NULL if there is no action.
The orientation of the page

memberdef.name: defaultCTM

detaileddescription.para: The default CTM
Gets the links of the page
Returns the annotations of the page

simplesect.para: If you call this method twice, you get different objects pointing to the same annotations (see Annotation). The caller owns the returned objects and they should be deleted when no longer required.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the annotations of the page

parameterdescription.para: the subtypes of annotations you are interested in

simplesect.para: If you call this method twice, you get different objects pointing to the same annotations (see Annotation). The caller owns the returned objects and they should be deleted when no longer required.

detaileddescription.para: Adds an annotation to the page

simplesect.para: Ownership of the annotation object stays with the caller, who can delete it at any time.

detaileddescription.para: Removes an annotation from the page and destroys the annotation object

simplesect.para: There mustn't be other Annotation objects pointing this annotation

detaileddescription.para: Returns the form fields on the page The caller gets the ownership of the returned objects.
Returns the page duration. That is the time, in seconds, that the page should be displayed before the presentation automatically advances to the next page. Returns < 0 if duration is not set.
Returns the label of the page, or a null string is the page has no label.

briefdescription.para: A page in a document.

detaileddescription.para: The Page class represents a single page within a PDF document.
You cannot construct a Page directly, but you have to use the Document functions that return a new Page out of an index or a label.
